fullText:
Democracy Dies in DarknessReview by Celia WrenAt the start of “Moulin Rouge! The Musical,” the award-winning extravaganza now at the Kennedy Center Opera House, two showgirl characters do a circus trick — a sword-swallowing act — seeming to ingest the blades until only the hilts are visible, before drawing the weapons out safely. If only the rest of the show pulled off its bold moves with as little damage.

dtliExcerpt: It's a feast for the senses but leaves you hungry for more... The musical adaptation of Baz Luhrmann's film is undeniably spectacular, yet it feels oddly hollow at its core.

This balanced critique with no clear recommendation falls into Mixed territory. | GPT-4o: The review acknowledges the spectacle and sensory appeal of the production but criticizes it for lacking depth, suggesting a mixed reception. | Gemini: The review acknowledges the spectacle but also notes a hollowness, suggesting a recommendation with reservations. Given the single excerpt, I'm placing it at the lower end of the positive range.
